docs.text: sydney lumet is the director whose work happens to be of varied quality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he is praised for some of the most important films of the previous decades , like twelve angry men , serpico or the verdict .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , in the same time , almost any of such pearls is followed by stinkers that hamper lumet's reputation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a stranger among us , 1992 rip-off of peter weir's witness , belongs to the latter category .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the heroine of this movie is emily eden ( melanie griffith ) , tough lady cop who sometimes shows too much enthusiasm in battling bad guys on the streets of new york .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: during one of such actions , her partner nick ( jamey sheridan ) got hurt and as a result , she becomes depressed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in order to help her recover , bosses give her rather easy task of locating missing jeweller who belonged to hassidic jew community .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: emily starts investigation and soon realises that the case involves murder .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: concluding that the perpetrator belongs to community , she decides to go undercover .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that isn't easy , because her modern manners are colliding with traditionalist ways .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: things get even more complicated when she develops feelings for young cabalistic scholar ariel ( eric thal ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: using peter weir's formula isn't the greatest flaw of this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even the lame and unispiring crime mystery subplot works to the certain extent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the worst insult to viewer's audience is terrible miscasting of melanie griffith .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the author of this review never liked this actress very much , but she was at least tolerable in some of her roles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: role of emily eden , unfortunately , isn't one of them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first of all , she can't pass for tough nypd street fighter , and her attempt to pass for orthodox jewish woman isn't much better .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: screenplay by robert j . avrech makes things even worse with some formulaic red herring subplots ( scene involving two italian gangsters was almost too painful to watch ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , on the other hand , other actors are more convincing ( lee richardson as an old rabbi , thal as ariel and charming mia sara as his intended bride ) , and the photography by andrzej bartkowiak very effectively creates atmosphere of warmth when the scenes take place in hassidic community .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also , the film might educate viewers about hassidic culture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is the only thing that prevents it from turning into total waste of time .
docs.label: negative
